TypeSignature.Value: public class FieldTemplateUserControl : System.Web.UI.UserControl, System.Web.DynamicData.IFieldTemplate, System.Web.UI.IBindableControl
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit FieldTemplateUserControl extends System.Web.UI.UserControl implements class System.Web.DynamicData.IFieldTemplate, class System.Web.UI.IBindableControl
Public Class FieldTemplateUserControl Inherits UserControl Implements IBindableControl, IFieldTemplate
public ref class FieldTemplateUserControl : System::Web::UI::UserControl, System::Web::DynamicData::IFieldTemplate, System::Web::UI::IBindableControl
type FieldTemplateUserControl = class inherit UserControl interface IBindableControl interface IFieldTemplate

Docs.summary: Represents the base class for all field template controls.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ASP.NET Dynamic Data field templates are ASP.NET user controls that map data controls to data types in a data model. Field templates derive from <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.FieldTemplateUserControl>, the class that enables access to data fields, data columns, and metadata in data models. Dynamic Data projects provide field templates by default. You can modify the field templates provided by default or create custom field templates.
This class inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.UserControl> Class.
## Examples The following code example creates a field template that displays data fields that have a many-to-one relationship and renders a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink> control that redirects the user to the relationship page.
The following example shows the code file for the ForeignKey.ascx user control.
```vb Public Partial Class ForeignKeyField Inherits System.Web.DynamicData.FieldTemplateUserControl
Protected Function GetDisplayString() As String Return FormatFieldValue( _ ForeignKeyColumn.ParentTable.GetDisplayString(FieldValue)) End Function
Public Overloads Overrides ReadOnly Property DataControl() As Control Get Return HyperLink1 End Get End Property End Class ```
```csharp public partial class ForeignKeyField : System.Web.DynamicData.FieldTemplateUserControl { protected string GetDisplayString() { Return FormatFieldValue(ForeignKeyColumn.ParentTable.GetDisplayString(FieldValue));
public override Control DataControl { get { return HyperLink1; } } ```
The following example shows the ForeignKey.aspx file.
```vb <%@ Control Language="VB" CodeFile="ForeignKey.ascx.vb" Inherits="ForeignKeyField" %>
<asp:HyperLink ID="HyperLink1" runat="server" Text="<%# GetDisplayString() %>" /> ```
```csharp <%@ Control Language="C#" CodeFile="ForeignKey.ascx.cs" Inherits="ForeignKeyField" %>
<asp:HyperLink ID="HyperLink1" runat="server" Text="<%# GetDisplayString() %>" /> ```
To compile the example code, you need the following:
- [!INCLUDE[vs_dev10_long](~/includes/vs-dev10-long-md.md)] or [!INCLUDE[vwd_exp_dev10_long](~/includes/vwd-exp-dev10-long-md.md)].
- A Dynamic Data Web site. For more information, see [Walkthrough: Creating a New Dynamic Data Web Site Using Scaffolding](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/1564aef2-9103-436a-9806-c8ad7abd616a).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance string BuildChildrenPath(string path) cil managed
Protected Function BuildChildrenPath (path As String) As String

Docs.summary: Gets the URL that links to the page that displays the list of children entities and allows the path to be overridden.
Docs.returns: The URL that links the displayed page to the children page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is similar to <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.FieldTemplateUserControl.ChildrenPath%2A>, except that it allows the path part of the URL to be overridden. This method is used if the pages are not located in the DynamicData\CustomPages folder of the Dynamic Data project. This method applies to Children columns only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance string BuildForeignKeyPath(string path) cil managed

Docs.summary: Get the URL that links the current page to the page that displays the details of the foreign key entity and allows the path to be overridden.
Docs.returns: The URL that links to the page that displays the details of the foreign key page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is similar to <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.FieldTemplateUserControl.ForeignKeyPath%2A> except that it allows the path of the URL to be overridden. This property is used if the page is not located in the DynamicData\CustomPages folder your the Dynamic Data project.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ChildrenColumn As MetaChildrenColumn

Docs.summary: Gets the object associated with a field template.
Docs.value: A column that represents a one-to-many relationship.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property casts a <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn> to a <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaChildrenColumn>. If the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn> class is not a children column, this property throws an exception.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected ReadOnly Property ChildrenPath As String
protected: property System::String ^ ChildrenPath { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the URL that links to a page that displays a list of children entities.
Docs.value: The URL that links the displayed page to the children entities.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method returns a URL that links to a page that displays a list of children entities. For example, the products column in the ProductCategories table in the AdventureWorksLT sample database has URLs that link to the list of product that are in the selected category. This property only applies to children columns.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class converts the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn> to a <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn>. The class throws an exception if <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn> is not a foreign key column.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected ReadOnly Property ForeignKeyPath As String
protected: property System::String ^ ForeignKeyPath { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Get the URL that links the current page to the page that displays the details of the foreign key entity.
Docs.value: The URL that links to the details of the foreign key data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the data column has a many-to-one relationship, this property returns a URL that links to the page that displays the details of the foreign key entity. For example, in the Category column of the Product table in the Northwind Database, this method can return a link that goes to the details of the category that the product belongs to. This property applies to foreign key columns only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void IgnoreModelValidationAttribute(class System.Type attributeType) cil managed

Docs.summary: Allows a to ignore a specific type of model validation attribute.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method allows a <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicValidator> to ignore a specific type of model Validation attributes. This method is called when the attribute type is already handled by an ASP.NET validation controls. Without this call, the validation can occur two times, resulting in a duplicate error message.

Docs.summary: Gets the mode a field template uses.

The column for which to validator is set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method used to set up <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicControl.ValidationGroup%2A> on all validators.
It performs additional logic for specific validator types in this method. For example, if range values exit in the data model this method sets up <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RangeValidator>.
